data.text: Walk or bike across the Golden Gate Bridge
data.subtext: Iconic 1.7-mile bridge with stunning bay views - best at sunrise or sunset
Historic former prison with fascinating tours - book tickets in advance
See sea lions, enjoy clam chowder in sourdough bowls, and waterfront views
Historic streetcars through steep hills - take the Powell-Hyde line for best views
Larger than Central Park - includes Japanese Tea Garden, de Young Museum, and Conservatory
Oldest Chinatown in North America with great food, shops, and Dragon's Gate

data.text: See the Painted Ladies at Alamo Square
data.subtext: Famous Victorian houses with city skyline backdrop - perfect photo op
Vibrant neighborhood with colorful murals, trendy restaurants, and Dolores Park
'Crookedest street in the world' with eight hairpin turns and beautiful gardens
Charming waterfront town with art galleries, shops, and restaurants across the bay

textResponse: here are the top must-do activities when visiting san francisco, from iconic landmarks to local favorites!
